channel.title: The Joe Rogan Experience
channel.description: The official podcast of comedian Joe Rogan. Follow The Joe Rogan Clips show page for some of the best moments from the episodes.

item.title: JRE MMA Show #122 with Jake Shields
item.description: Joe sits down with Jake Shields: a veteran mixed martial artist and grappler who competed for multiple organizations, among them the UFC, PFL, and Strikeforce.

item.title: #1806 - Duncan Trussell
item.description: Duncan Trussell is a stand-up comedian, writer, actor, and host of the "Duncan Trussell Family Hour" podcast. http://www.duncantrussell.com/

item.title: #1805 - Mike Tyson
item.description: Mike Tyson is the former undisputed heavyweight boxing champion of the world and host of the “Hotboxin’ with Mike Tyson” podcast.  http://www.miketyson.com/ http://www.hotboxinpodcast.com/

item.title: JRE MMA Show #121 with Bobby Green
item.description: Joe is joined by Bobby Green, a mixed martial artist currently competing in the Lightweight division for the UFC.

item.title: #1804 - Bill Maher
item.description: Bill Maher is a comedian, political commentator, the host of HBO's "Real Time with Maher" and his own podcast, "Club Random." His new special "#Adulting" is available April 15 on HBOMax. http://www.billmaher.com/videos/club-random-videos/

item.title: #1803 - Greg Fitzsimmons
item.description: Greg Fitzsimmons is a stand-up comedian, actor, and writer. He's also the host of "Fitzdog Radio" podcast and co-hosts the podcasts "Sunday Papers" with Mike Gibbons, and "Childish" with Alison Rosen.

item.title: #1802 - Protect Our Parks 3
item.description: Shane Gillis, Mark Normand, and Ari Shaffir are stand-up comedians, writers, and podcasters. Shane is the co-host of "Matt and Shane's Secret Podcast" with Matt McCusker.. His special "Shane Gillis: Live in Austin," is available via YouTube. Mark is the co-host of "Tuesdays with Stories" along with Joe List. His latest special, "Mark Normand: Out to Lunch," is available via YouTube. Ari is the host of "The Skeptic Tank." His most recent special, "Ari Shaffir: Double Negative," is available via Netflix.

item.title: JRE MMA Show #120 with Jim Miller
item.description: Joe is joined by mixed martial artist Jim Miller: a competitor in the UFC lightweight division and the host of his own program, "The Jim Miller Podcast."

item.title: #1801 - David Mamet
item.description: David Mamet is a playwright, screenwriter, director, and author. He has won a Pulitzer prize and received Tony nominations for his plays, "Glengarry Glen Ross" and "Speed-the-Plow." His screenwriting credits include "The Verdict" and "The Untouchables." His latest book, "Recessional: The Death of Free Speech and the Cost of a Free Lunch," is available now.

item.title: #1800 - Gavin de Becker
item.description: Gavin de Becker is a leading authority on the prediction and management of violence. A three-time presidential appointee, he and his firm Gavin de Becker and Associates have provided protection, investigation, and threat assessment services for numerous high profile individuals and organizations.

item.title: #1799 - Yannis Pappas
item.description: Yannis Pappas is a stand-up comedian, actor, and writer. He's also the host of the "Long Days with Yanni" podcast. Watch his special, "Blowing The Light," now available on YouTube.

item.title: #1798 - Michael Shellenberger
item.description: Michael Shellenberger is an author, president of the non-profit research group Environmental Progress, and a candidate for the governorship of California. His most recent book, "San Fransicko: Why Progressives Ruin Cities," is available now.

item.title: #1797 - Josh Barnett
item.description: Josh Barnett is a mixed martial artist, professional wrestler, color commentator, and host of "Josh Barnett's Bloodsport."

item.title: #1796 - Ali Siddiq
item.description: Ali Siddiq is a stand-up comedian, writer, and community advocate. His most recent special is "Ali Siddiq: It's Bigger Than These Bars," filmed live at Bell County Jail in Texas.

item.title: #1795 - Antonio Garcia Martinez
item.description: Antonio García Martínez is a tech entrepreneur, writer, former Facebook product manager, and author of "Chaos Monkeys: Obscene Fortune and Random Failure in Silicon Valley."

item.title: #1794 - Monty Franklin
item.description: Monty Franklin is a stand-up comedian, actor, writer, and television personality.

item.title: #1793 - Mike Baker
item.description: Mike Baker is a former CIA covert operations officer and current CEO of Portman Square Group, a global intelligence firm. He's also the host of "Black Files Declassified" on Discovery+ and the Science Channel.

item.title: #1792 - Daryl Davis & Bill Ottman
item.description: Daryl Davis is a musician, activist, and author of "Klan-Destine Relationships: A Black Man's Odyssey in the Ku Klux Klan." Bill Ottman is an Internet entrepreneur, free speech activist, and CEO of Minds, a blockchain based social network. Davis and Ottman have launched #ChangeMinds: a new deradicalization initiative based upon the idea that deplatforming actually intensifies extremism.

item.title: #1791 - Sadhguru
item.description: Sadhguru is a yogi, mystic and visionary. Named one of India’s 50 most influential people, and recipient of 3 presidential awards, Sadhguru has touched the lives of millions worldwide through his transformational programs.  An internationally renowned speaker and author of the New York Times bestsellers "Inner Engineering" and "Karma," Sadhguru has been an influential voice at major global forums like the United Nations and the World Economic Forum, addressing issues as diverse as socioeconomic development, leadership and spirituality. He established Isha Foundation, a non-profit, volunteer-run organization supported by over 16 million volunteers worldwide, and has initiated several projects for social revitalization, education and the environment.

item.title: #1790 - Nims Purja
item.description: Nims is the multi world record breaking mountaineer who climbed all 14 of the world’s ‘Death Zone’ peaks over 8,000m in just 6 months and 6 days. He was part of the first winter ascent of the ‘Savage Mountain’ K2. His film, "14 Peaks: Nothing Is Impossible," is out now on Netflix, as is his best-selling book, "Beyond Possible." Nims is a UNEP Mountain Advocate and founder of the Nimsdai Foundation.

item.title: #1789 - Tom Papa
item.description: Comedian and writer Tom Papa is the host of the popular podcast "Breaking Bread with Tom Papa", and the co-host, along with Fortune Feimster, of the Netflix radio program "What a Joke with Papa and Fortune." It can be heard daily on Sirius XM.

item.title: #1788 - Mr. Beast
item.description: Jimmy "MrBeast" Donaldson is an internet personality, businessman, and philanthropist. He operates several popular YouTube channels, a delivery based fast food restaurant, MrBeast Burger, and two philanthropic programs: Beast Philanthropy, and Team Trees.

item.title: JRE MMA Show #119 with Michael Bisping
item.description: Joe is joined by retired former UFC Middleweight Champion turned fight analyst and color commentator, Michael Bisping. Look for the documentary "Bisping: The Michael Bisping Story" on March 22.

item.title: #1787 - Dakota Meyer
item.description: Dakota Meyer is a retired United States Marine, veteran of the War in Afghanistan, and Medal of Honor recipient. He is co-author, with Robert O'Neill, of "The Way Forward: Master Life's Toughest Battles and Create Your Lasting Legacy."

item.title: #1786 - Freddie Gibbs & Brian Moses
item.description: Freddie Gibbs is a rapper, founder of the ESGN music label, and 2020 Grammy Award Nominee. Brian Moses is a comedian, writer, creator, producer and host of Roast Battle.

item.title: #1785 - Earthquake
item.description: Earthquake is a standup comedian, actor, and radio personality. He's the host of "Quakeshouse" on SiriusXM and Kevin Hart's Laugh Out Loud Network. Look for his Netflix comedy special, "Earthquake: Legendary," on February 28.

item.title: #1784 - Diana Rodgers & Robb Wolf
item.description: Diana Rodgers is a registered dietitian, nutritionist, and host of the "Sustainable Dish" podcast. Robb Wolf is a former research biochemist, author, and co-host of "The Healthy Rebellion" radio podcast, alongside his wife Nicki Violetti. They are the co-authors of "Sacred Cow: The Case for (Better) Meat,"  a companion book to the documentary of the same name

item.title: #1783 - Ben Burgis
item.description: Ben Burgis is a columnist for Jacobin Magazine, an adjunct philosophy professor at Morehouse College, and the host of the podcast and YouTube show “Give Them An Argument.” He's the author of several books including “Christopher Hitchens: What He Got Right, How He Went Wrong, and Why He Still Matters” and “Canceling Comedians While the World Burns: A Critique of the Contemporary Left.”

item.title: #1782 - Daniel Holzman
item.description: Daniel Holzman is the chef and restaurateur behind New York City's The Meatball Shop and Danny Boy's Famous Original Pizza in Los Angeles. His new book, "Food IQ: 100 Questions, Answers, and Recipes to Raise Your Cooking Smarts," is available now.

item.title: #1781 - Coleman Hughes
item.description: Coleman Hughes is a writer and opinion columnist who specializes in issues related to race, public policy, and applied ethics. He's also the host of the "Conversations with Coleman" podcast.

item.title: #1780 - Maajid Nawaz
item.description: Maajid Nawaz is a former Islamist turned counter-extremism activist, author of multiple books, and public speaker.

item.title: #1779 - Michael Osterholm
item.description: Dr. Michael Osterholm is an expert in infectious disease epidemiology, professor, and director of the Center for Infectious Disease Research and Policy. He's also the host of "The Osterholm Update: COVID-19" podcast, and author of multiple books, including "Deadliest Enemy: Our War Against Killer Germs."

item.title: #1778 - Joey Diaz
item.description: Joey Diaz is a stand-up comedian, actor, and host of the podcast "Uncle Joey's Joint."

item.title: #1777 - Andrew Dessler
item.description: Andrew Dessler is a climate scientist and professor of Atmospheric Sciences at Texas A&M University. He served as a Senior Policy Analyst in the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy under President Bill Clinton, and is a Google Science Communication Fellow. Dessler is also the author of several books, among them the award-winning "Introduction to Modern Climate Change."

item.title: #1776 - Steven E. Koonin
item.description: Steven E. Koonin is a theoretical physicist, professor, former Chief Scientist for the BP petroleum company, and former Under Secretary for Science  at the U.S. Department of Energy under the Obama administration. He's also the author of "Unsettled: What Climate Science Tells Us, What It Doesn't, and Why It Matters."

item.title: #1775 - Dave Smith
item.description: Dave Smith is a stand-up comedian and political commentator. He is also the host of the "Part of the Problem" podcast, and co-host of the "Legion of Skanks" podcast.

item.title: #1774 - Josh Dubin
item.description: Josh Dubin is a criminal justice reform advocate and civil rights attorney.

item.title: #1773 - Akaash Singh
item.description: Akaash Singh is a stand-up comedian, podcaster, and actor. You can hear him along with Andrew Schulz on the "Flagrant 2" podcast, and watch his new special, "Bring Back Apu," available now on YouTube.

item.title: #1772 - Randall Carlson
item.description: Randall Carlson is a master builder and architectural designer, scholar, and teacher. His podcast, "Kosmographia," investigates the catastrophic history of the world and evidence for advanced knowledge in earlier cultures.

item.title: #1771 - Andy Stumpf
item.description: Andy Stumpf is a retired Navy SEAL, record-setting wingsuit pilot, BASE jumper, public speaker, and host of the popular podcast "Cleared Hot."

item.title: Hello Friends
item.description: Joe's thoughts

item.title: JRE MMA Show #118 with Julianna Peña
item.description: Joe sits down with UFC Women's Bantamweight Champion Juliana Peña.

item.title: #1770 - Valentine Thomas
item.description: Valentine Thomas is a former attorney and financier turned free-diver, spear-fisher, chef, and author.

item.title: #1769 - Jordan Peterson
item.description: Jordan Peterson is a clinical psychologist and the author of several best-selling books, among them "12 Rules for Life: An Antidote to Chaos," and "Beyond Order: 12 More Rules for Life."

item.title: #1768 - Dr. Robert Epstein
item.description: Dr. Robert Epstein is an author, professor, and Senior Research Psychologist at American Institute for Behavioral Research and Technology: a non-profit, non-partisan organization that offers data regarding the power of Google and other Big Tech companies to censor dissenting opinions online and sway the outcome of elections.

item.title: #1767 - James Lindsay
item.description: James Lindsay is an author, mathematician, podcaster, and founder of New Discourses: an online resource for educating the public on the dangers of the "Critical Social Justice" movement. His latest book, co-authored with Charles Pincourt, is "Counter Wokecraft: A Field Manual for Combatting the Woke in the University and Beyond."

item.title: #1766 - Ben Patrick
item.description: Ben Patrick, known online as "the Knees Over Toes Guy," is a coach and owner of ATG: an online personal training program for strengthening knees and developing full body fitness. His new book, "ATG for Life," is available now.

item.title: #1765 - Phillip Frankland Lee
item.description: Phillip Frankland Lee is a restaurateur and chef. He is also the co-owner, along with his wife Margarita Kallas-Lee, of Scratch Restaurants Group: the entity behind several popular Los Angeles and Austin restaurants.

item.title: #1764 - Ari Shaffir, Shane Gillis & Mark Normand
item.description: Shane Gillis, Mark Normand, and Ari Shaffir are standup comedians, writers, and podcasters. Mark is the co-host of "Tuesdays with Stories" along with Joe List. His latest special, "Mark Normand: Out to Lunch," is available via YouTube. Ari is the host of "The Skeptic Tank." His most recent special, "Ari Shaffir: Double Negative," is available via Netflix. Shane is the co-host of "Matt and Shane's Secret Podcast" with Matt McCusker. His special "Shane Gillis: Live in Austin," is available via YouTube.

item.title: #1763 - General H.R. McMaster
item.description: General H.R. McMaster is a retired United States Army lieutenant general who served as the 26th United States National Security Advisor from 2017 to 2018. He is also known for his roles in the Gulf War, Operation Enduring Freedom, and Operation Iraqi Freedom and is currently a senior fellow at the Hoover Institution at Stanford University.  His books, "Battlegrounds" and "Dereliction of Duty" are bestsellers. He is host of the podcast "Battlegrounds: International Perspectives" and a regular on the podcast "Goodfellows."

item.title: #1762 - Josh Szeps
item.description: Josh Szeps is a broadcaster who hosts "Afternoons with Josh Szeps" on ABC Radio. His podcast is Uncomfortable Conversations with Josh Szeps.

item.title: #1761 - Jim Gaffigan
item.description: Jim Gaffigan is a standup comedian, author, and actor. His new special, "Comedy Monster," is now streaming on Netflix.

item.title: #1760 - Adam Curry
item.description: Adam Curry is an internet entrepreneur, former MTV VJ, and podcasting pioneer. He is the co-host, along with John C. Dvorak, of the "No Agenda" podcast.

item.title: #1759 - Oliver Stone
item.description: Oliver Stone is a film director, producer, and screenwriter whose credits include "Platoon," "JFK," and "Wall Street." His new documentary, "JFK Revisited: Through the Looking Glass," is currently available on SHOWTIME.

item.title: #1758 - Carrot Top
item.description: Scott "Carrot Top" Thompson is a standup comedian, television personality, and actor currently in residence at the Las Vegas Luxor Hotel and Casino.

item.title: #1757 - Dr. Robert Malone, MD
item.description: Dr. Robert Malone is the inventor of the nine original mRNA vaccine patents, which were originally filed in 1989 (including both the idea of mRNA vaccines and the original proof of principle experiments) and RNA transfection. Dr. Malone, has close to 100 peer-reviewed publications which have been cited over 12,000 times. Since January 2020, Dr. Malone has been leading a large team focused on clinical research design, drug development, computer modeling and mechanisms of action of repurposed drugs for the treatment of COVID-19. Dr. Malone is the Medical Director of The Unity Project, a group of 300 organizations across the US standing against mandated COVID vaccines for children. He is also the President of the Global Covid Summit, an organization of over 16,000 doctors and scientists committed to speaking truth to power about COVID pandemic research and treatment.

item.title: #1756 - John Abramson
item.description: John Abramson, MD, is a Harvard Medical School Lecturer, national drug litigation expert, and author. His new book, "Sickening: How Big Pharma Broke American Health Care and How We Can Repair It," will be available on February 8.

item.title: #1755 - Tony Woods
item.description: Tony Woods is a veteran standup comedian and comedy writer. An original member of Russell Simmons' Def Comedy Jam, Woods was cited as a major influence by Dave Chappelle.

item.title: #1754 - Suzanne Santo
item.description: Suzanne Santo is an actress, model, and singer-songwriter. Her latest album, "Yard Sale," is available now.

item.title: #1753 - Brian Redban
item.description: Brian Redban is a comedian and the founder of the Deathsquad podcast network.

item.title: #1752 - Tim Dillon
item.description: Tim Dillon is a stand up comedian and CEO of Fake Business. His podcast “The Tim Dillon Show” is available on Spotify.

item.title: #1751 - Brian Simpson
item.description: Brian Simpson is a standup comedian and host of the podcast "BS with Brian Simpson." He's also on Season 3 of The Standup on Netflix premiering on Decemeber 29.

item.title: #1750 - Ari Shaffir & Tony Hinchcliffe
item.description: Ari Shaffir is the host of "The Skeptic Tank." His most recent special, "Ari Shaffir: Double Negative," is available via Netflix. Tony Hinchcliffe is a stand-up comedian, writer, and actor. He's also the co-host, along with Brian Redban, of the podcast and live YouTube show Kill Tony.

item.title: #1749 - Shane Dorian
item.description: Shane Dorian is a former WSL Championship surfer and is now considered by many to be one of the best big wave riders in the world. He's also an avid bowhunter and a co-founder of Revelshine: an organic and sustainable wine brand.

item.title: JRE MMA Show #117 with Marlon "Chito" Vera
item.description: Joe sits down with Marlon "Chito" Vera, an Ecuadorian mixed martial artist currently competing in the bantamweight division of the UFC.

item.title: #1748 - Beeple
item.description: Mike "Beeple" Winkelmann is a digital artist whose body of work includes concert visuals for Eminem and deadmau5, multiple short films, and an ongoing series of images posted daily to his popular instagram account: Beeple_Crap.

item.title: #1747 - Dr. Peter A. McCullough
item.description: Dr. Peter A. McCullough, MD, MPH, is a board-certified cardiologist who has testified before committees of the US and Texas Senate regarding the treatment of COVID-19 and management of the ongoing pandemic.

item.title: #1746 - Blaire White
item.description: Blaire White is a YouTuber and political commentator.

item.title: JRE MMA Show #116 with George Kambosos
item.description: Joe sits down with George Kamobosos Jr., who has held the WBA, IBF, WBO and The Ring lightweight titles since November 2021.

item.title: #1745 - Matt Taibbi
item.description: Matt Taibbi is a journalist and author. He writes and publishes the TK News newsletter on Substack and co-hosts the podcast "Useful idiots with Matt Taibbi and Katie Halper."

item.title: #1744 - Derek from More Plates More Dates
item.description: Derek is the fitness educator and entrepreneur behind the "More Plates, More Dates" YouTube channel, podcast and companion website.

item.title: #1743 - Steven Pinker
item.description: Steven Pinker is the Harvard College Professor of Psychology at Harvard University. His newest book, "Rationality: What It Is, Why It Seems Scarce, Why It Matters," is available now.

item.title: #1742 - Jimmy Corsetti
item.description: Jimmy Corsetti is the independent researcher behind "Bright Insight": a YouTube channel exploring ancient mysteries and lost civilizations.

item.title: #1741 - Ted Nugent
item.description: Ted Nugent is a singer-songwriter, outdoorsman, and political activist. His newest single, "Come and Take It," is out now.

item.title: #1740 - Jocko Willink
item.description: Jocko Willink is a decorated retired Navy SEAL officer, author, and host of "The Jocko Podcast." His new novel, "Final Spin," is available now.

item.title: #1739 - Philip Goff
item.description: Philip Goff is a philosopher and consciousness researcher at Durham University. His new book, "Galileo's Error: Foundations for a New Science of Consciousness," is available now.

item.title: #1738 - Ben O'Brien
item.description: Ben O’Brien is a writer, editor, and member of the Backcountry Hunters and Anglers Board of Directors.

item.title: #1737 - Tim Pool
item.description: Tim Pool is a journalist, political commentator, and host of the "Timcast" podcast and Youtube program.

item.title: #1736 - Tristan Harris & Daniel Schmachtenberger
item.description: Tristan Harris is a former Google design ethicist, co-founder and president of the Center for Humane Technology, and co-host of the Center for Humane Technology’s "Your Undivided Attention" podcast with Aza Raskin. Daniel Schmachtenberger is a founding member of The Consilience Project, aimed at improving public sensemaking and dialogue.

item.title: #1735 - Peter Attia
item.description: Peter Attia is a physician focused on the applied science of longevity and the host of "The Drive" podcast.

item.title: #1734 - Ron White
item.description: Ron White is a standup comedian, actor, and author. Catch him live on tour this year.

item.title: #1733 - Snoop Dogg
item.description: Snoop Dogg is a rapper, actor, and businessman. Check out "Snoop Dogg Presents: The Algorithm" on 11/12/21.

item.title: #1732 - Ben Shapiro
item.description: Ben Shapiro is a political commentator, host of "The Ben Shapiro Show," and author of "The Authoritarian Moment: How the Left Weaponized America's Institutions Against Dissent."

item.title: #1731 - Theo Von
item.description: Theo Von is a standup comedian and podcaster. He is the host of "This Past Weekend with Theo Von" and co-host, along with Brendan Schaub, of "The King and the Sting." Check out his new special "Regular People" on Netflix.

item.title: #1730 - Cameron Hanes
item.description: Master bowhunter and elite athlete Cameron Hanes has successfully taken down some of the toughest game in the roughest environments nature has to offer, all in pursuit of becoming “the ultimate predator.” He’s the author of Backcountry Bowhunting: a Guide to the Wildside, and the host of the podcast Keep Hammering with Cameron Hanes.

item.title: #1729 - Gilbert Gottfried
item.description: Gilbert Gottfried is a standup comedian, actor, author, and host, along with Frank Santopadre, of ”Gilbert Gottfried’s Amazing Colossal Podcast!” available on Spotify.

item.title: #1728 - Ari Shaffir, Shane Gillis & Mark Normand
item.description: Shane Gillis, Mark Normand, and Ari Shaffir are standup comedians, writers, and podcasters. Shane is the co-host of "Matt and Shane's Secret Podcast" with Matt McCusker. His special "Shane Gillis: Live in Austin," is available via YouTube. Mark is the co-host of "Tuesdays with Stories" along with Joe List. His latest special, "Mark Normand: Out to Lunch," is available via YouTube. Ari is the host of "The Skeptic Tank." His most recent special, "Ari Shaffir: Double Negative," is available via Netflix.

item.title: #1727 - Rob Kearney
item.description: Rob Kearney is the world's first openly gay professional strongman. He's also the co-author of the children's book "Strong," along with writer Eric Rosswood, and illustrator Nidhi Chanani.

item.title: #1726 - Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: Chuck Palahniuk is the award-winning author of "Fight Club," "Choke," and other books. His new essay, "People, Places, Things: My Human Landmarks," is available now exclusively through Scribd.com

item.title: #1725 - Bridget Phetasy
item.description: Bridget Phetasy is a writer, stand-up comedian, and host of the YouTube program "Dumpster Fire" and podcast "Walk-Ins Welcome."

item.title: #1724 - Jewel
item.description: Jewel is a Grammy award-nominated singer-songwriter, author, actress, and philanthropist.

item.title: JRE MMA Show #115 with Valentina Schevchenko
item.description: Joe is joined by Valentina Shevchenko, the current UFC Women's Flyweight Champion.

item.title: #1723 - Amishi Jha
item.description: Dr. Amishi Jha is a professor of psychology at the University of Miami, and Director of Contemplative Neuroscience for the Mindfulness Research and Practice Initiative. She is the author of "Peak Mind: Find Your Focus, Own Your Attention, Invest 12 Minutes a Day."

item.title: #1722 - Bartow Elmore
item.description: Bart Elmore is the associate professor of environmental history and core faculty member of the Sustainability Institute at the Ohio State University. He's the author of "Seed Money: Monsanto's Past and Our Food Future."

item.title: #1721 - Michael Malice
item.description: Michael Malice is a cultural commentator and host of the PodcastOne podcast "Your Welcome." He's the author of two books, "Dear Reader: The Unauthorized Autobiography of Kim Jong Il," and "The New Right: A Journey to the Fringe of American Politics."

item.title: #1720 - Tony Hinchcliffe & Brian Redban
item.description: Tony Hinchcliffe is a stand-up comedian, writer, and actor. He's also the co-host, along with Brian Redban, of the podcast and live YouTube show Kill Tony.

item.title: #1719 - Michael Shellenberger
item.description: Michael Shellenberger is a journalist and author. His latest book, "San Fransicko: Why Progressives Ruin Cities," will be published on October 12, 2021.

item.title: #1718 - Dr. Sanjay Gupta
item.description: Dr. Sanjay Gupta is a practicing neurosurgeon, chief medical correspondent for CNN, and host of the network's podcast "Chasing Life." His new book, "World War C: Lessons from the Covid-19 Pandemic and How to Prepare for the Next One," is available now.

item.title: #1717 - Alex Berenson
item.description: Alex Berenson is a journalist and author of both fiction and non-fiction. His latest book, "Pandemia: How Coronavirus Hysteria Took Over Our Government, Rights, and Lives," will be published on November 30, 2021.

item.title: #1716 - Steven Rinella
item.description: Steven Rinella is an outdoorsman, writer, and host of the television series "MeatEater" and its companion podcast. His new audiobook, "MeatEater’s Campfire Stories: Close Calls," is available now.

item.title: #1715 - Jessica Kirson
item.description: Jessica Kirson is a standup comedian, television producer, and host of the "Disgusting Hawk" podcast. "The Call Girls," a prank call compilation album Kirson recorded with fellow comedian Rachel Feinstein, is available now.

item.title: #1714 - Josh Dubin & Robert Jones
item.description: Josh Dubin is an Ambassador to The Innocence Project, Criminal justice reform advocate, attorney, and president of Dubin Research and Consulting. On January 26, 2017, Robert Jones was exonerated of four separate crimes, including rape, robbery, kidnapping and manslaughter, which had terrified tourists and residents over a two-month period in 1992 in New Orleans. He is now a motivational speaker and community activist, poverty abolitionist and one of the co-founders of Free-Dem Foundations, Inc; a nonprofit organization that mentors and guides the youth in a positive direction. https://www.instagram.com/robertjonesofnola

item.title: #1713 - Mike Baker
item.description: Mike Baker is a former CIA covert operations officer and current CEO of Portman Square Group, a global intelligence firm. He's also the host of "Black Files Declassified" on Discovery’s Science Channel.

item.title: #1712 - Bert Kreischer (Part 2)
item.description: Bert Kreischer is a standup comedian, broadcast personality, and podcaster. He hosts television's "Go-Big Show," "The Bertcast" podcast, and co-hosts the "2 Bears, 1 Cave" podcast with Tom Segura. (This part 2 of a 2-part podcast.)

item.title: #1712 - Bert Kreischer (Part 1)
item.description: Bert Kreischer is a standup comedian, broadcast personality, and podcaster. He hosts television's "Go-Big Show," "The Bertcast" podcast, and co-hosts the "2 Bears, 1 Cave" podcast with Tom Segura. (This part 1 of a 2-part podcast.)

item.title: #1711 - Patrick Bet-David
item.description: Patrick Bet-David is an entrepreneur, author, and founder of Valuetainment: a multimedia company focusing on business and personal development. He's also the host of "The Bet-David Podcast."

item.title: #1710 - Cullen Hoback
item.description: Cullen Hoback is an investigative filmmaker whose latest doc series "Q: Into The Storm" is now available on HBO Max. He also made "Terms and Conditions May Apply" and "What Lies Upstream".

item.title: #1709 - Amanda Knox
item.description: Amanda Knox spent four years in an Italian prison following a wrongful conviction for the murder of her roommate: a sentence that was ultimately overturned by the Italian Supreme Court. She is now an author, journalist, and podcaster. Knox, along with her husband Christopher Robinson, hosts the podcast "Labyrinths."

item.title: #1708 - Anna Lembke
item.description: Anna Lembke is a psychiatrist, author and specialist in the treatment of addiction. Her new book, "Dopamine Nation: Finding Balance in the Age of Indulgence," is available now.

item.title: #1707 - Kyle Dunnigan & Kurt Metzger
item.description: Kyle Dunnigan and Kurt Metzger are standup comedians, actors, and the creators of "Fresh Prez of DC," a satirical comedy series on YouTube. They are also podcasters. Dunnigan is the host of "The Kyle Dunnigan Show" and Metzger is the host of "Can't Get Right with Kurt Metzger."

item.title: #1706 - Billy Corben
item.description: Billy Corben is a documentarian and producer. His new series, "Cocaine Cowboys: The Kings of Miami," is now available on Netflix.

item.title: #1705 - Bret Weinstein & Heather Heying
item.description: Biologists Bret Weinstein and Heather Heying are the hosts of the "DarkHorse Podcast" and authors of "A Hunter-Gatherer's Guide to the 21st Century: Evolution and the Challenges of Modern Life." Look for it on September 14, 2021.

item.title: #1704 - C.K. Chin
item.description: C.K. Chin is the Austin, Texas-based restaurateur behind such popular eateries as Swift's Attic, Wu Chow Austin, and Native Hostel.

item.title: #1703 - Tom Segura
item.description: Tom Segura is a stand-up comedian, and co-host of "Your Mom's House" and "2 Bears, 1 Cave" podcasts. He is also the host of "Tom Segura en Español" a Spanish language podcast.

item.title: #1702 - Laurie Woolever
item.description: Laurie Woolever is the author of "Bourdain: The Definitive Oral Biography," and a co-host of the "Carbface for Radio" Podcast.

item.title: #1701 - Dr. Rhonda Patrick
item.description: Dr. Rhonda Patrick is a PhD in biomedical science, and an expert on nutritional health. She's also the host of the "Found My Fitness" podcast.

item.title: #1700 - Eleanor Kerrigan
item.description: Eleanor Kerrigan is a standup comedian, actor, and co-host of "The Comedy Store" podcast. Her new comedy album, "Lady Like," is available now.

item.title: #1699 - Meghan Murphy
item.description: Meghan Murphy is a freelance writer, and journalist. She is also the founder of the "Feminist Current" website and the host of "The Same Drugs" podcast.

item.title: #1698 - Neill Blomkamp
item.description: Neill Blomkamp is a film director, producer, screenwriter, and animator. His latest film, "Demonic," is in theaters and video on demand now.

item.title: #1697 - Zuby
item.description: Zuby is an independent rapper, public speaker, author, and host of the "Real Talk with Zuby" podcast.

item.title: #1696 - Lex Fridman
item.description: Lex Fridman is a scientist and researcher in the fields of artificial intelligence and autonomous vehicles, as well as the host of "The Lex Fridman Podcast."

item.title: #1695 - Andrew Schulz
item.description: Andrew Schulz is a standup comedian, actor, and co-host of the "Brilliant Idiots" and "Flagrant 2" podcasts.

item.title: #1694 - Ms. Pat & Jordan E. Cooper
item.description: Ms. Pat is a standup comedian, a host of "The Patdown" podcast, and star of the BET+ series "The Ms. Pat Show." Jordan E. Cooper is a playwright, writer and co-creator & executive producer of "The Ms. Pat Show."

item.title: JRE MMA Show #114 with Rickson Gracie
item.description: Rickson Gracie is a ninth-degree red belt in Brazilian jiu-jitsu, retired MMA fighter, and author of "Breathe: A Life in Flow."

item.title: #1693 - Evan Hafer
item.description: Special Forces veteran turned entrepreneur Evan Hafer is the founder and CEO of Black Rifle Coffee Company, and one of the hosts of the Free Range America podcast.

item.title: #1692 - Jason Wilson
item.description: Martial artist Jason Wilson is the founder and head instructor of the Cave of Adullam Transformational Training Academy. His new book Battle Cry: Waging and Winning the War Within will be released on September 21, 2021.

item.title: JRE MMA Show #113 with Chad Mendes
item.description: Chad Mendes is a retired UFC Featherweight fighter, avid hunter, and owner of the outdoor guide service Finz and Featherz.

item.title: #1691 - Yeonmi Park
item.description: Yeonmi Park is a North Korean Human Rights Activist, and author of “In Order To Live: a North Korean Girl's Journey to Freedom.”

item.title: #1690 - JessiMae Peluso
item.description: Jessimae Peluso is a standup comedian and television personality. She's the host of "Tattoo Redo" on Netflix, and the "Sharp Tongue" podcast.

item.title: #1689 - Yannis Pappas
item.description: Yannis Pappas is a standup comedian, actor, and writer. He's also the host of the "Long Days with Yanni" podcast. Check out his special called "Blowing The Light" available on YouTube.

item.title: #1688 - Greg Fitzsimmons
item.description: Greg Fitzsimmons is a standup comedian, actor, and writer. He's also the host of "Fitzdog Radio" podcast and co-hosts the "Sunday Papers" with Mike Gibbons, and "Childish" with Alison Rosen podcasts.

item.title: #1687 - Jimmy Dore
item.description: Jimmy Dore is a standup comedian, political commentator, and host of “The Jimmy Dore Show.”

item.title: #1686 - Ari Shaffir
item.description: Ari Shaffir is a stand-up comedian and host of "The Skeptic Tank" podcast available on Spotify.

item.title: #1685 - Shane Gillis
item.description: Shane Gillis is a stand-up comedian, radio personality, and co-host with Matt McKusker of "Matt and Shane's Secret Podcast." Also look for "Gilly and Keeves" sketches on YouTube, a new sketch show created by John McKeever and Shane Gillis.

item.title: #1684 - Abby Martin
item.description: Abby Martin is a journalist, host of "The Empire Files" video series, and director of the 2019 documentary "Gaza Fights for Freedom."

item.title: #1683 - Andrew Huberman
item.description: Andrew Huberman is a Professor of Neurobiology and Ophthalmology at Stanford University, and host of the "Huberman Lab" Podcast.

item.title: #1682 - Jesse Singal
item.description: Jesse Singal is the author of "The Quick Fix: Why Fad Psychology Can't Cure Our Social Ills" and the cohost of the podcast "Blocked and Reported." Check out more of his stuff at jessesingal.substack.com/about.

item.title: #1681 - Brian Simpson
item.description: Brian Simpson is a standup comedian and host of the podcast "BS with Brian Simpson."

item.title: #1680 - Jakob Dylan
item.description: Singer-songwriter Jakob Dylan is the frontman of The Wallflowers. Their new album, "Exit Wounds," is set for release on July 9.

item.title: #1679 - Adam Curry
item.description: Adam Curry is an internet entrepreneur, former MTV VJ, and podcasting pioneer. He is the co-host, along with John C. Dvorak, of the "No Agenda" podcast.

item.title: #1678 - Michael Pollan
item.description: Michael Pollan is an author, professor, and journalist. His newest book, "This is Your Mind on Plants," is available on July 6.

item.title: #1677 - Tim Dillon
item.description: Tim Dillon is a comedian, tour guide, and host. His podcast “The Tim Dillon Show” is available on Spotify.

item.title: #1676 - Jesse Griffiths
item.description: Jesse Griffiths is a butcher, hunter, author, and restauranteur. He is the co-owner of Dai Due Supper Club and The New School of Traditional Cookery. His new book "The Hog Book: a Chef's Guide to Hunting, Butchering and Cooking Wild Pigs" is available now only at TheHogBook.com

item.title: #1675 - Quentin Tarantino
item.description: Quentin Tarantino is a writer, producer, and director. Tarantino's novelization of his Oscar-winning film "Once Upon a Time...in Hollywood" is available now.

item.title: #1674 - Clay Newcomb
item.description: Clay Newcomb is a 7th-generation Arkansan that grew up in the Ouachita Mountains. He's a hunter, mule skinner, curious naturalist, and observer of rural culture. He's also a writer, filmmaker, owner/publisher of "Bear Hunting Magazine" and host of the hit MeatEater podcast "Bear Grease."

item.title: #1673 - Colin Wright
item.description: Colin Wright is a biologist and Managing Editor of "Quillette", a magazine dedicated to freethought. He is also the founder of "Reality's Last Stand", a publication and newsletter exploring the debate around sex and gender.

item.title: #1672 - Iliza Shlesinger
item.description: Iliza Shlesinger is a comedian, actor, writer, and host of the podcast "Ask Iliza Anything." Her new film, "Good on Paper", premieres June 23 on Netflix.

item.title: #1671 - Bret Weinstein & Dr. Pierre Kory
item.description: Dr. Pierre Kory is an ICU and lung specialist who is an expert on the use of the drug ivermectin to treat COVID-19. Bret Weinstein is an evolutionary biologist, visiting fellow at Princeton, host of the DarkHorse podcast, and co-author (with his wife, Heather Heying) of the forthcoming "A Hunter-Gatherer's Guide to the 21st Century."

item.title: JRE MMA Show #112 with Don Frye
item.description: Joe sits down with mixed martial artist Don Frye: a UFC Hall of Famer, former pro wrestler, and co-host, along with Dan Severin, of "Dan and Don’s Toxic Masculinity Podcast."

item.title: #1670 - David Sinclair
item.description: David Sinclair is a Harvard researcher who believes aging is a treatable disease. His book Lifespan: Why We Age and Why We Don't Have To is available now.

item.title: #1669 - Kyle Kulinski
item.description: Kyle Kulinski is a political activist and commentator, progressive talk radio host, and co-founder of Justice Democrats. He also hosts the show “Secular Talk” and is the co-host of "Krystal Kyle & Friends" available now at https://krystalkyleandfriends.substack.com/

item.title: #1668 - Krystal Ball & Saagar Enjeti
item.description: Krystal Ball and Sagaar Enjeti are political commentators and hosts of the YouTube show and podcast "Breaking Points".

item.title: #1667 - Annie Lederman
item.description: Annie Lederman is a standup comedian, host of the "Meanspiration" podcast, and look for her new merch at AnnieLederman.com

item.title: #1666 - Duncan Trussell
item.description: Duncan Trussell is a standup comedian, host of the "Duncan Trussell Family Hour" podcast, and co-creator and star of "The Midnight Gospel" television series.

item.title: #1665 - Carole Hooven
item.description: Carole Hooven is an evolutionary biologist at Harvard University. Her new book, "T: The Story of Testosterone, the Hormone that Dominates and Divides Us", will be available July 13.

item.title: #1664 - Josh Dubin
item.description: Josh Dubin is a criminal justice reform advocate, attorney, and Ambassador Advisor to the Innocence Project.

item.title: #1663 - Edward Slingerland
item.description: Edward Slingerland is the Distinguished University Scholar and Professor of Philosophy at the University of British Columbia. His newest book, “Drunk”, is available now.

item.title: #1662 - Tom Papa
item.description: Comedian and writer Tom Papa is the host of the popular podcast "Breaking Bread with Tom Papa", and the co-host, along with Fortune Feimster, of the Netflix radio program "What a Joke with Papa and Fortune." It can be heard daily on Sirius XM.

item.title: #1661 - Rick Doblin
item.description: Rick Doblin is the founder and Executive Director of the non-profit psychedelic research and educational organization, the Multidisciplinary Association for Psychedelic Studies (MAPS). http://maps.org/join

item.title: #1660 - David Lee Roth
item.description: David Lee Roth is a singer, songwriter, solo artist, and the voice of the Grammy Award-Winning hard rock band Van Halen.

item.title: #1659 - Scott Eastwood
item.description: Scott Eastwood is an actor, producer, entrepreneur and the co-founder of the Made Here Brand.

item.title: JRE MMA Show #111 with John Danaher
item.description: Joe is joined by the legendary jiu jitsu coach and founder of the Danaher Death Squad, John Danaher.

item.title: JRE MMA Show #110 with Craig Jones & Alex Volkanovski
item.description: Joe is joined by top ranked jiu jitsu grappler Craig Jones & UFC Feather Champion Alex Volkanovski.

item.title: #1658 - Neil deGrasse Tyson
item.description: Neil deGrasse Tyson is an astrophysicist, director of the Hayden Planetarium at the Rose Center for Earth and Space in New York City, and host of StarTalk Radio. His newest book, "Cosmic Queries", is available now.

item.title: #1657 - Mayor Steve Adler
item.description: Steve Adler is lawyer and politician who has been the Mayor of Austin, Texas since 2015. Adler has been a practicing attorney in Austin in the areas of eminent domain and civil rights law for 35 years.

item.title: #1656 - Adam Duritz
item.description: Adam Duritz is a singer, songwriter, and frontman of the Counting Crows. The band's first record in seven years, "Butter Miracle, Suite One", is available now.

item.title: #1655 - Sebastian Junger
item.description: Sebastian Junger is a bestselling author, journalist, and an Academy Award-nominated documentary filmmaker. His latest book, "Freedom", is available now.

item.title: #1654 - Whitney Cummings
item.description: Whitney Cummings is a standup comedian, author, actor, and host of the "Good for You" podcast.

item.title: #1653 - Andy Norman
item.description: Andy Norman teaches philosophy and directs the Humanism Initiative at Carnegie Mellon University. He is the author of "Mental Immunity: Infectious Ideas, Mind Parasites and the Search for a Better Way to Think," available now. http://andynorman.org/

item.title: #1652 - Anthony Cumia
item.description: Anthony Cumia is an on-air personality, host of "The Anthony Cumia Show", and founder of the Compound Media streaming network.

item.title: #1651 - Joe List
item.description: Joe List is a standup comedian, co-host of the "Tuesdays with Stories" podcast with Mark Normand, and host of his podcast "Joe List's Mindful Metal Jacket".

item.title: #1650 - Russell Peters
item.description: Russell Peters is a standup comedian, actor, and the host of the "Culturally Cancelled" podcast.

item.title: #1649 - Michael Easter
item.description: Michael Easter was a contributing editor at Men's Health magazine, columnist for Outside magazine, and is professor at UNLV. He also is the author of the new book "The Comfort Crisis: Embrace Discomfort To Reclaim Your Wild, Happy, Healthy Self" available now.

item.title: #1648 - Reggie Watts
item.description: Reggie Watts is a comedian, actor, and musician who currently leads the house band for "The Late, Late Show with James Corden." Catch him live as part of HiFi Labs' virtual Friend Fest, which begins streaming on Friendfe.st May 14 at 7 PM EDT.

item.title: #1647 - Dave Chappelle
item.description: Dave Chappelle is a comedian, actor, writer, and producer. He is the recipient of multiple honors, among them the Mark Twain Prize for American Humor, and several Grammy Awards. He's the co-host, along with Talib Kweli and Yasiin Bey, of "The Midnight Miracle" podcast, scheduled to release in May.

item.title: #1646 - David Holthouse
item.description: David Holthouse is a writer and filmmaker whose investigation into a triple homicide in California's Emerald Triangle became the subject of the HULU documentary "Sasquatch".

item.title: #1645 - Christopher Mellon
item.description: Christopher Mellon spent nearly twenty years in Washington serving in various intelligence roles, among them Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense for Intelligence, and Former Minority Staff Director for the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence.

item.title: #1644 - Ethan Suplee
item.description: Ethan Suplee is an actor and host of the "American Glutton" podcast.

item.title: JRE MMA Show #109 with Gordon Ryan
item.description: Gordon Ryan is a submission grappler and mixed martial artist currently signed to ONE Championship.

item.title: #1643 - Jonathan Zimmerman
item.description: Jonathan Zimmerman is a professor of education and history at the University of Pennsylvania and author of "Free Speech and Why You Should Give a Damn".

item.title: #1642 - Andrew Santino
item.description: Andrew Santino is a standup comedian and actor. He's the host of the "Whiskey Ginger" podcast and co-host of the "Bad Friends" podcast with Bobby Lee.

item.title: #1641 - Matty Matheson
item.description: Matty Matheson is a chef and author. He's the host of the YouTube series "Just A Dash" and co-host of the "Powerful Truth Angels" podcast.

item.title: #1640 - Josh Rogin
item.description: Josh Rogin is a journalist, political analyst, and author of "Chaos Under Heaven: Trump, Xi, and the Battle for the 21st Century".

item.title: #1639 - Dave Smith
item.description: Dave Smith is a stand-up comedian and political commentator. He is also the host of the "Part of the Problem" podcast, and co-host of the "Legion of Skanks" podcast.

item.title: JRE MMA Show #108 with Stephen Thompson
item.description: Joe is joined by Stephen "Wonderboy" Thompson: a mixed martial artist currently competing in the Welterweight division of the UFC.

item.title: #1638 - Dr. Shanna Swan
item.description: Shanna Swan is an environmental epidemiologist whose work examines the impact of chemical exposure on reproductive health and child development. Her book, "Count Down", is available now.

item.title: #1637 - Action Bronson
item.description: Action Bronson is a musician, chef, painter, and author. His book, "F*ck It, I'll Start Tomorrow: A True Story", is available now.

item.title: #1636 - Colion Noir
item.description: Colion Noir is a second amendment advocate, attorney, and firearms enthusiast.

item.title: #1635 - Katie Spotz
item.description: Katie Spotz is an endurance athlete, author, and philanthropist. She's the only American to have rowed solo from Africa to South America.

item.title: #1634 - Jack Carr
item.description: Jack Carr is a New York Times bestselling author,  former Navy SEAL, and host of the Danger Close podcast. His newest novel, "The Devil's Hand", is available now.

item.title: #1633 - Ali Macofsky
item.description: Ali Macofsky is a standup comedian and host of the Resting Bitch podcast.

item.title: #1632 - Tom Segura
item.description: Tom Segura is a stand-up comedian, and co-host of "Your Mom's House" and "2 Bears, 1 Cave" podcasts. He is also the host of "Tom Segura en Español" a Spanish language podcast.

item.title: #1631 - Brian Greene
item.description: Brian Greene is a professor of physics and mathematics at Columbia University, and the author of several books. His latest, "Until the End of Time", is now available in paperback.

item.title: JRE MMA Show #107 with Georges St-Pierre
item.description: Joe is joined by UFC Hall of Famer and actor Georges St-Pierre.

item.title: #1630 - Dan Crenshaw
item.description: Dan Crenshaw is a former United States Navy SEAL, current US Representative for Texas's 2nd Congressional District, and host of the "Hold These Truths with Dan Crenshaw" podcast.

item.title: #1629 - Lara Beitz
item.description: Lara Beitz is a standup comic known for her appearances on Comedy Central's "Lights Out with David Spade", Showtimes' "The Comedy Store" mini-series, and stages around the United States.

item.title: #1628 - Eric Weinstein
item.description: Eric Weinstein is a mathematician, economist, managing director at Thiel Capital, and host of "The Portal" podcast.

item.title: #1627 - Dan Gable
item.description: Dan Gable is a retired wrestler, coach, Olympic gold medalist, and recipient of the Presidential Medal of Freedom.

item.title: #1626 - Alex Honnold
item.description: Alex Honnold is a professional adventure rock climber, author, and co-host, with Fitz Cahall, of the "Climbing Gold" podcast.

item.title: #1625 - Demi Lovato
item.description: Demi Lovato is an award-winning singer, author, and subject of the new YouTube documentary "Demi Lovato: Dancing with the Devil". Look for her latest album, "Dancing with the Devil... the Art of Starting Over", on April 2.

item.title: #1624 - Mark Sisson
item.description: Mark Sisson is a fitness author, paleo diet expert, and retired elite athlete. His newest book is "Two Meals a Day: The simple, sustainable strategy to lose fat, reverse aging, & break free from diet frustration forever".

item.title: #1623 - Doug Stanhope
item.description: Doug Stanhope is a standup comedian, author, and host of the Doug Stanhope Podcast. Check out his latest audiobook No Encore for the Donkey, available now as an Audible Original.

item.title: #1622 - Marcus Luttrell
item.description: Marcus Luttrell is a retired Navy SEAL and recipient of the Navy Cross and Purple Heart. He is the author of "Lone Survivor", the basis for the 2013 film, and host of the Team Never Quit podcast.

item.title: #1621 - Jim Breuer
item.description: Jim Breuer is a standup comedian, actor, and host of the Jim Breuer Podcast. Catch him live on the "Freedom of Laughter" tour.

item.title: JRE MMA Show #106 with Leon Edwards
item.description: Joe is joined by mixed martial artist Leon Edwards, who is currently competing in the UFC's Welterweight division.

item.title: #1620 - Nate Bargatze
item.description: Nate Bargatze is a standup comedian and host of the "Nateland" podcast. His new comedy special, "The Greatest Average American", premieres March 18 on Netflix.

item.title: #1619 - Claressa Shields
item.description: Claressa Shields is a two-time olympic gold medalist and holder of multiple world championship belts. She is the first fighter in boxing history to be an undisputed champion in two different weight divisions in the four-belt era.

item.title: JRE MMA Show #105 with Derrick Lewis
item.description: Joe is joined by UFC Heavyweight Derrick Lewis.

item.title: #1618 - Mat Fraser
item.description: Matt Fraser is a retired professional CrossFit athlete. He holds the distinction of being the most decorated competitor in the sport. He is the first and only person to win five CrossFit Games titles, winning the 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, and 2020 CrossFit Games consecutively.

item.title: #1617 - Mike Baker
item.description: Mike Baker is a former CIA covert operations officer. He is now the president and cofounder of Diligence LLC, a global intelligence and security firm. Mike is also the host of "Black Files Declassified" now available on Discovery+.

item.title: #1616 - Jamie Metzl
item.description: Jamie Metzl is a futurist, author, and founder of OneShared.World.

item.title: JRE MMA Show #104 with Cory Sandhagen
item.description: Joe is joined by Cory Sandhagen, a professional mixed martial artist competing in the UFC's Bantamweight division.

item.title: #1615 - Hamilton Morris
item.description: Hamilton Morris is the creator and host of the Vice TV documentary series "Hamilton's Pharmacopeia," now in its third season.

item.title: #1614 - Tiller Russell
item.description: Tiller Russell is the director of the new feature film "Silk Road," and Netflix's limited documentary series "Night Stalker: The Hunt for a Serial Killer".

item.title: #1613 - Ayaan Hirsi Ali
item.description: Ayaan Hirsi Ali is a human rights activist and author of the new book "Prey: Immigration, Islam, and the Erosion of Women's Rights."

item.title: JRE MMA Show #103 with Max Holloway
item.description: Joe is joined by former UFC Featherweight Champion Max Holloway.

item.title: JRE MMA Show #102 with Dustin Poirier
item.description: Dustin Poirier is a mixed martial artist, one-time UFC interim lightweight champion, and president of The Good Fight, a nonprofit charitable organization.

item.title: #1612 - Robert Bigelow
item.description: Robert Bigelow is an aerospace entrepreneur and founder of the Bigelow Institute for Consciousness Studies: an organization supporting research into the survival of human consciousness after death.

item.title: JRE MMA Show #101 with Kevin Holland & Travis Lutter
item.description: Joe is joined by Kevin Holland, a mixed martial artist competing in the UFC middleweight division and his head coach, Travis Lutter, retired mixed martial artist who won The Ultimate Fighter 4.

item.title: #1611 - Freddie Gibbs & Brian Moses
item.description: Brian Moses is a comedian, writer, producer, and co-creator of Roast Battle. Freddie Gibbs is a rapper, founder of the ESGN music label, and 2020 Grammy Award Nominee. Check out "Moses's Traveling Cocaine Circus" on February 23 at Vulcan Gas Co in Austin, TX.

item.title: #1610 - Snowpocalypse with Tim Dillon
item.description: Tim Dillon is a standup comedian, actor, and host of the Tim Dillon Show.

item.title: JRE MMA Show #100 with Cody Garbrandt
item.description: Cody Garbrandt is a professional mixed martial artist and former UFC bantamweight champion. He's also the author of "The Pact", the story of his rough upbringing in a small Appalachian town.

item.title: #1609 - Elon Musk
item.description: Elon Musk is a business magnate, designer, and engineer. His portfolio of businesses include Tesla, Inc., SpaceX, Neuralink, and many others.

item.title: #1608 - Michael Malice
item.description: Michael Malice is a cultural commentator and host of the GaS Digital Network podcast "Your Welcome". He's the author of two books, "Dear Reader: The Unauthorized Autobiography of Kim Jong Il", and "The New Right: A Journey to the Fringe of American Politics", and co-author of many others.

item.title: JRE MMA Show #99 with Francis Ngannou
item.description: Francis Ngannou is a professional mixed martial artist competing in the heavyweight division of the UFC. When he's not busy training for his next fight, he works to empower the youth of his native Cameroon through the Francis Ngannou Foundation.

item.title: #1607 - Fahim Anwar
item.description: Fahim Anwar is a stand-up comic, actor, and former aerospace engineer. In addition to starring in his own solo comedy special, "There's No Business Like Show Business" on available on YouTube, Anwar is also a founding member of the sketch comedy group Goatface, and has appeared in several comedy films and tv series.

item.title: #1606 - Ali Siddiq
item.description: Ali Siddiq is a stand-up comic and writer who initially developed his comedic talents during a six-year stint behind bars. Now a successful headliner, Siddiq spends his time offstage volunteering to meet the needs of his Houston, Texas community. His most recent special is "It's Bigger Than These Bars", filmed live at Bell County Jail in Texas.

item.title: #1605 - Mark Smith
item.description: Mark Smith is an airline pilot, mixed martial arts referee, judge, and trainer, and corporate health and wellness advocate. Prior to his career in the private sector, Smith served his country as an Air Force F-16 fighter pilot, with tours at NASA, the White House, and the elite flying group the Thunderbirds. https://www.instagram.com/markdsmithmma

item.title: #1604 - Jamar Neighbors
item.description: Jamar Neighbors is an actor and stand-up comedian.

item.title: #1603 - Brendan Schaub
item.description: Brendan Schaub is a comedian, actor, and retired mixed martial artist. He is the host of the The Fighter and the Kid and Below the Belt podcasts.

item.title: #1602 - Justin Wren
item.description: Justin Wren is a professional mixed martial artist, humanitarian aid-worker, and founder of Fight for the Forgotten: a non-profit benefiting the Mbuti Pygmy people of the Congo.

item.title: #1601 - Brian Redban
item.description: Brian Redban is a comedian, producer, and co-host of the podcast and live-streaming YouTube show Kill Tony, and founder of the Deathsquad podcast network.

item.title: #1600 - Lex Fridman
item.description: Scientist Lex Fridman researches human-centered artificial intelligence and autonomous vehicles at MIT, and is also the host of the Lex Fridman podcast.

item.title: #1599 - Tulsi Gabbard
item.description: Tulsi Gabbard is a Former United States Representative, presidential candidate, and Iraq War veteran. Currently, she serves as the leader of Tulsi Aloha, a political action committee.

item.title: #1598 - Mark "The Undertaker" Calaway
item.description: World Wrestling Entertainment Hall of Famer Mark "The Undertaker" Calaway is a thirty-year veteran of the sports entertainment industry, and widely considered one of the best professional wrestlers of all time. Now retired from the ring, his story is the subject of the wrestling retrospective "Undertaker: The Last Ride".

item.title: #1597 - Travis Walton
item.description: Travis Walton's personal story of alien abduction inspired the science-fiction film "Fire in the Sky", and has been featured in multiple documentaries devoted to the subject of UFOs.

item.title: #1596 - Avi Loeb
item.description: Professor Avi Loeb is a theoretical physicist whose areas of professional interest include cosmology and astrophysics. His new book, "Extraterrestrial: The First Sign of Intelligent Life Beyond Earth", proposes that 'Oumuamua, the interstellar object that passed through our solar system in 2017, may have been the creation of an alien intelligence.

item.title: #1595 - Ira Glasser
item.description: Ira Glasser is a former director of the American Civil Liberties Union and a lifelong defender of every citizen's right to free speech. He is the subject of the 2020 documentary "Mighty Ira", available now on streaming video.

item.title: #1594 - Yannis Pappas
item.description: Yannis Pappas is a stand-up comedian, actor, and writer. He is the co-host, with Chris Distefano, of the "History Hyenas" podcast, and host of the "Long Days" show on YouTube.

item.title: #1593 - Dr. Carl Hart
item.description: Professor Carl Hart is an expert in the fields of neuropsychopharmacology and behavioral neuroscience. A longtime champion for evidence-based drug policies, Hart has written a number of influential books in the field. His newest is "Drug Use for Grown-Ups: Chasing Liberty in the Land of Fear".

item.title: #1592 - Bryan Fogel
item.description: Filmmaker Bryan Fogel's "Icarus" won the Academy Award for Best Documentary Feature in 2018. His newest documentary, "The Dissident", is an investigation of the death of Saudi Arabian "Washington Post" journalist Jamal Khashoggi, murdered at the hands of his own government. "The Dissident" is now available On Demand and in theaters.

item.title: #1591 - Jordan Burroughs
item.description: Wrestler Jordan Burroughs is an Olympic Gold medalist, four-time World Champion, six-time World Cup champion, three-time Pan American Games Gold medalist and four-time Pan American champion.

item.title: #1590 - Phil Demers
item.description: Phil Demers is a former professional marine mammal trainer and subject of the new documentary "The Walrus and the Whistleblower".

item.title: #1589 - Dr. Mark Gordon & Andrew Marr
item.description: Dr. Mark Gordon is an expert in the field of neuroregenerative medicine and the treatment of Traumatic Brain Injuries. SFC Andrew Marr is a Green Beret, co-founder of the Warrior Angels Foundation, and author of "Tales from the Blast Factory". He is also one of the subjects in the new documentary "Quiet Explosions" available now. Video credit: "Coronavirus Epidemic Update 34: US Cases Surge, Chloroquine & Zinc Treatment Combo, Italy Lockdown" by MedCram - Medical Lectures Explained CLEARLY - https://youtu.be/U7F1cnWup9M

item.title: #1588 - Lawrence Wright
item.description: Lawrence Wright is the Pulitzer Prize-winning author of multiple books including "Going Clear: Scientology, Hollywood & the Prison of Belief", and "The Looming Tower: Al-Qaeda and the Road to 9/11". His newest title is "The End of October", a medical thriller about a doctor's race to stop a global pandemic.

item.title: #1587 - Mark Normand
item.description: Mark Normand is a stand-up comedian, actor, and co-host of the Tuesdays with Stories! podcast with Joe List. His latest comedy special, Out to Lunch, is available now.

item.title: #1586 - Tony Hinchcliffe
item.description: Tony Hinchcliffe is a stand-up comedian, writer, and actor. He's also the co-host, along with Brian Redban, of the podcast and live-streaming YouTube show Kill Tony.

item.title: #1585 - Michael Kosta
item.description: Standup comedian Michael Kosta can be seen regularly on "The Daily Show with Trevor Noah", and is the host of the "Tennis Anyone?" podcast. His new Comedy Central special, "Michael Kosta: Detroit. NY. LA." is available now.

item.title: #1584 - Todd White
item.description: Todd White is a fourth-degree black belt in Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu and an instructor at Jean Jacques Machado Austin. Check out his art at https://www.toddwhite.com/ and @artofwhite on Instagram.

item.title: #1583 - John Terzian & Craig Susser
item.description: John Terzian is co-founder and co-president of Los Angeles-based hospitality and lifestyle firm The h.wood Group. Craig Susser is the owner of the Los Angeles restaurant Craig's, and creator of the non-dairy ice cream brand Craig's Vegan.

item.title: #1582 - Alex Berenson
item.description: Alex Berenson is a journalist and award-winning author of both fiction and non-fiction. His newest work, "Unreported Truths about COVID-19 and Lockdowns: Part 1: Introduction and Death Counts and Estimates", can be downloaded from Amazon and other ebook retailers.

item.title: #1581 - J. Prince
item.description: J. Prince is the CEO of Rap-A-Lot Records, author of The Art & Science of Respect, and founder of The Loyalty Collection, a limited collection of fine wines.

item.title: #1580 - Andrew Schulz
item.description: Standup comedian Andrew Schulz is the star of the four-part Netflix special Schulz Saves America, and co-hosts The Brilliant Idiots podcast with Charlamagne Tha God, and Flagrant 2 with Akaash Singh.

item.title: #1579 - Suzanne Santo & Gary Clark Jr.
item.description: Singer/songwriter Suzanne Santo is the lead vocalist and co-founder of HoneyHoney, as well as a solo artist who is currently at work on her second album. Gary Clark Jr. is a Grammy award winning singer, songwriter, and guitar player.

item.title: #1578 - Richard Rawlings
item.description: Richard Rawlings is the star of the Discovery Channel series Fast N' Loud and Garage Rehab. He's also the owner of Gas Monkey Garage and Gas Monkey Bar N' Grill.

item.title: #1577 - Terry Virts
item.description: Terry W. Virts is a retired astronaut, International Space Station Commander, test pilot, and colonel in the United States Air Force. Virts spent over 213 days in space over the course of his career with NASA. His new book How to Astronaut: An Insider's Guide to Leaving Planet Earth is now available.

item.title: #1576 - Mariana van Zeller
item.description: Mariana van Zeller is an award-winning journalist and documentarian. Her latest project is Trafficked: a National Geographic television series that takes her deep into the most dangerous black markets in the world.

item.title: #1575 - Bill Burr
item.description: Bill Burr is a standup comedian, actor, and host of the Monday Morning Podcast. He's also the voice of Frank Murphy in the Netflix animated sitcom F is for Family, currently in its fourth season.

item.title: #1574 - Jacques Vallée & James Fox
item.description: Jacques Vallée is a venture capitalist, technologist, and world-renowned figure in the field of unidentified aerial phenomena. James Fox is the director of The Phenomenon: a new documentary about UFOs and a global effort to conceal their existence.

item.title: #1573 - Matthew Yglesias
item.description: Journalist Matthew Yglesias writes about politics and economic policy at Vox.com, a site he co-founded, and also co-hosts The Weeds: a regular podcast devoted to current events. Yglesias is also the author of two books, the most recent of which is One Billion Americans: The Case for Thinking Bigger.

item.title: #1572 - Moxie Marlinspike
item.description: Computer security researcher Moxie Marlinspike is the creator of the encrypted messenger service Signal, and co-founder of the Signal Foundation: a nonprofit dedicated to global freedom of speech through the development of open-source privacy technology.

item.title: #1571 - Emily Harrington
item.description: Rock climber and adventurer Emily Harrington is a five-time US National Champion in Sport Climbing. She has scaled some of the world's most formidable mountains, including Everest, Ama Dablam, and Cho Oyu, and is the first woman to free climb El Capitan via Golden Gate in under 24 hours.

item.title: #1570 - Willie D & Mike Judge
item.description: Rapper, songwriter, and entrepreneur Willie D is a founding member of the classic hip hop group Geto Boys. In addition to his music career, he has been a candidate for public office, written for a widely-read advice column, and is a former Golden Gloves champion boxer. https://www.youtube.com/c/WillieDLive Mike Judge is a writer, director, actor, and filmmaker. He's the creator of Beavis & Butthead, co-creator of King of the Hill & also Silicon Valley, and director of movies such as "Office Space" & "Idiocracy." **The 2nd half of this video is AUDIO ONLY. No video is available due to a hard drive error.**

item.title: #1569 - John Mackey
item.description: John Mackey is the CEO and co-founder of Whole Foods Market, co-founder of the nonprofit Conscious Capitalism, Inc., and co-author of Conscious Leadership: Elevating Humanity Through Business.

item.title: #1568 - Tom Green
item.description: Tom Green is a comedian, actor, filmmaker, and talk show host. His latest project is The Tom Green Interview: a podcast series featuring weekly conversations with celebrities, newsmakers, and everyday people.

item.title: #1567 - Donnell Rawlings & Dave Chappelle
item.description: Donnell Rawlings is a stand up comedian, actor, and podcaster. His podcast, The Donnell Rawlings Show, is available on YouTube and most podcast platforms. Dave Chappelle is a stand up comedian and actor. Look for Chappelle's Show now streaming on Netflix.

item.title: #1566 - Nicholas Christakis
item.description: Nicholas A. Christakis is the Sterling Professor of Social and Natural Science at Yale University, where he also directs the Human Nature Lab, and serves as Co-Director of the Yale Institute for Network Science. His most recent book is Apollo's Arrow: The Profound and Enduring Impact of Coronavirus on the Way We Live. https://www.amazon.com/Apollos-Arrow-Profound-Enduring-Coronavirus/dp/0316628212

item.title: #1565 - Gary Laderman
item.description: Gary Laderman is a professor of American religious history and cultures At Emory University. He teaches and writes about death and dying, religion and sexuality, and sacred drugs. His most recent book is Don't Think About Death: A Memoir on Mortality.

item.title: #1564 - Adam Alter
item.description: Adam Alter is a Professor of Marketing at New York University’s Stern School of Business and the author of two books, Drunk Tank Pink, and Irresistible: The Rise of Addictive Technology and the Business of Keeping Us Hooked.

item.title: #1563 - Tony Hinchcliffe
item.description: Tony Hinchcliffe is a stand-up comedian, writer, and actor. He's also the co-host, along with Brian Redban, of the podcast and live-streaming YouTube show Kill Tony.

item.title: #1562 - Dave Smith
item.description: Stand-up comedian, radio personality, and political commentator Dave Smith is the host of the Part of the Problem podcast and a co-host of The Legion of Skanks podcast, both part of the GaS Digital Network.

item.title: #1561 - Kermit Pattison
item.description: Kermit Pattison is a journalist whose work has appeared in the New York Times, GQ, Fast Company, Runners World, and many other publications. His new book, Fossil Men: The Quest for the Oldest Skeleton and the Origins of Humankind, is available now. https://www.harpercollins.com/products/fossil-men-kermit-pattison?variant=32117911748642

item.title: #1560 - Mike Baker
item.description: Mike Baker is a former CIA covert operations officer, host of the Science Channel series Black Files Declassified, and current president and cofounder of Diligence LLC, a global intelligence and security firm.

item.title: #1559 - Steven Rinella
item.description: Steven Rinella is an outdoorsman, author, and television personality. He currently hosts MeatEater, available on the Sportsman Channel and Netflix, as well as the MeatEater podcast. His new book The MeatEater Guide to Wilderness Skills and Survival is available on December 1.

item.title: JRE - End Of The World #2
item.description: Tim Dillon is a standup comedian, actor, and host of The Tim Dillon Show. Kyle Kulinski is a political activist, news commentator, and host of The Kyle Kulinski Show.

item.title: JRE MMA Show #98 with Luke Thomas
item.description: Joe sits down with combat sports journalist Luke Thomas, who reports on the latest in boxing and mixed martial arts on the CBS Sports programs Morning Kombat, and Morning Kombat: Dissected.

item.title: #1558 - Tristan Harris
item.description: Called the “closest thing Silicon Valley has to a conscience,” by The Atlantic magazine, Tristan Harris spent three years as a Google Design Ethicist developing a framework for how technology should “ethically” steer the thoughts and actions of billions of people from screens. He is now co-founder & president of the Center for Humane Technology, whose mission is to reverse ‘human downgrading’ and re-align technology with humanity. Additionally, he is co-host of the Center for Humane Technology’s Your Undivided Attention podcast with co-founder Aza Raskin.

item.title: #1557 - Gad Saad
item.description: Gad Saad is Professor of Marketing at Concordia University, and an expert in the application of evolutionary psychology in marketing and consumer behavior. He's the author of multiple scientific papers and several books, the most recent of which is The Parasitic Mind: How Infectious Ideas are Killing Common Sense.

item.title: #1556 - Glenn Greenwald
item.description: Former attorney turned award-winning journalist Glenn Greenwald is a co-founder of online news site The Intercept, and the author of several books, the most recent of which is No Place to Hide: Edward Snowden, the NSA, and the U.S. Surveillance State.

item.title: #1555 - Alex Jones & Tim Dillon
item.description: Tim Dillon is a standup comedian, actor, and host of the Tim Dillon Show. Alex Jones is a filmmaker, writer, and host of the Alex Jones Show.

item.title: #1554 - Kanye West
item.description: Kanye West is a rapper, record producer, fashion designer, and current independent candidate for office in the 2020 United States Presidential Election.

item.title: #1553 - Maynard James Keenan
item.description: Maynard James Keenan is a singer, songwriter, producer, winemaker, actor, and martial artist best known as the vocalist for Grammy Award-winning rock band Tool, Puscifer, and A Perfect Circle. Look for "Existential Reckoning", the new album from Puscifer, on October 30.

item.title: #1552 - Matthew McConaughey
item.description: Matthew McConaughey is an Academy Award-winning actor known for such films as Dazed and Confused, The Dallas Buyers Club, Interstellar, Free State of Jones, and the HBO television series True Detective. His new memoir Greenlights is now available everywhere and at https://greenlights.com

item.title: #1551 - Paul Saladino
item.description: Dr. Paul Saladino is a physician and board-certified nutrition specialist. He’s a leading expert in the science and practice of the carnivore diet, a food regimen to which Saladino credits numerous health benefits seen in the patients under his care.

item.title: #1550 - Wesley Hunt
item.description: Wesley Hunt is a candidate for Texas's 7th Congressional District. A Republican, he is running against Democratic incumbent Lizzie Fletcher. Hunt is a veteran of the Iraq war and former AH-64D Apache Longbow helicopter pilot. When he's not busy with his family or work, Hunt volunteers his time as a youth mentor and serves on the board of trustees for the Harris County Center for Mental Health.

item.title: #1549 - Tom Papa
item.description: Comedian and writer Tom Papa is the host of the popular podcast "Breaking Bread with Tom Papa" and the author of two books, the latest of which is "You're Doing Great! ... and Other Reasons to Stay Alive." In addition, Papa is also the co-host, along with Fortune Feimster, of the Netflix radio program "What a Joke with Papa and Fortune." It can be heard daily on Sirius XM.

item.title: #1548 - Roy Jones Jr.
item.description: Pro boxer Roy Jones Jr. captured championships in numerous weight divisions, at one time holding a record-breaking seven heavyweight belts simultaneously. In 2003, Jones made history by becoming the first middleweight champion to win a heavyweight title in 106 years. Jones officially retired from the sport in 2017, but signed on earlier this year to fight Mike Tyson in an highly anticipated exhibition bout.

item.title: #1547 - Colin Quinn
item.description: Comedian Colin Quinn is a veteran of stage and screen, with notable stints as a cast member of "Saturday Night Live", host of Comedy Central's "Tough Crowd with Colin Quinn", and star of multiple one-man shows on and off Broadway. Quinn is also the author of several books, the most recent of which is Overstated: A Coast-to-Coast Roast of the 50 States. Check out his new show "Cop Show" available now on Colin's YouTube channel: https://bit.ly/3iD0sjV

item.title: #1546 - Evan Hafer & Mat Best
item.description: Special Forces combat veterans turned entrepreneurs Mat Best and Evan Hafer are co-founders of Black Rifle Coffee Company: a veteran-owned and operated premium, small-batch coffee roastery. When they're not busy at BRCC, you can hear them with co-host Jarred "JT" Taylor on the Free Range American podcast.

item.title: #1545 - W. Keith Campbell
item.description: Social psychologist W. Keith Campbell is a recognized expert on narcissism and its influence on society at large. His latest book, The New Science of Narcissism, explores the origins of this character trait, why its presence has grown to almost epidemic proportions, and how all of us are at least a little narcissistic.

item.title: #1544 - Tim Dillon
item.description: Tim Dillon is a comedian, tour guide, and host. His podcast “The Tim Dillon Show” is available on Spotify.

item.title: #1543 - Brian Muraresku & Graham Hancock
item.description: Attorney and scholar Brian C. Muraresku is the author of The Immortality Key: The Secret History of the Religion with No Name. Featuring an introduction by Graham Hancock, The Immortality Key is a look into the psychedelic origins of the world's great spiritual practices and what those might mean for how we view ourselves and the world around us. Hancock's most recent book is America Before: The Key to Earth's Lost Civilization, now available in Paperback.

item.title: #1542 - Cameron Hanes
item.description: Master bowhunter and elite athlete Cameron Hanes has successfully taken down some of the toughest game in the roughest environments nature has to offer, all in pursuit of becoming “the ultimate predator.” He’s the author of Backcountry Bowhunting: a Guide to the Wildside, and the host of the podcast Keep Hammering with Cameron Hanes.

item.title: #1541 - Bridget Phetasy
item.description: Writer, stand-up comedian, and cultural commentator Bridget Phetasy’s writings can be found in The Spectator, Quillette, and The New York Times. In addition, she’s the host of the YouTube program Dumpster Fire, and the podcast Walk-Ins Welcome.

item.title: #1540 - Frank von Hippel
item.description: Frank A. Von Hippel is an expert in ecotoxicology: the study of how pollutants impact human health and the environment at large. A professor at Northern Arizona University, Von Hippel is the author of The Chemical Age: How Chemists Fought Famine and Disease, Killed Millions, and Changed Our Relationship with the Earth, and the host of The Science History Podcast.

item.title: #1539 - Jenny Kleeman
item.description: Award-winning documentarian and journalist Jenny Kleeman has reported for HBO’s Vice News Tonight, and BBC’s Unreported World. She is the author of Sex Robots & Vegan Meat: Adventures at the Frontier of Birth, Food, Sex & Death, available now from Pan MacMillan.

item.title: #1538 - Douglas Murray
item.description: Writer, journalist, and political commentator Douglas Murray is the author of The Madness of Crowds: Gender, Race and Identity, now available in a newly expanded paperback edition from Bloomsbury Publishing. Also look for The Strange Death of Europe available everywhere.

item.title: #1537 - Lex Fridman
item.description: Scientist Lex Fridman researches human-centered artificial intelligence and autonomous vehicles at MIT, and studies Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu in his spare time. Check out his podcast “Lex Fridman Podcast”, available now on Spotify.

item.title: #1536 - Edward Snowden
item.description: Former CIA contractor turned whistleblower Edward Snowden shocked the world when he revealed the misdeeds of the US intelligence community and its allies. Now living in Russia, he is a noted privacy advocate and author who serves as president of the Freedom of the Press Foundation. His book, Permanent Record, is now available in paperback from Henry Holt and Company.

item.title: Welcome To The Joe Rogan Experience
item.description: New episodes will be exclusively on Spotify starting December 1st, 2020.

item.title: #1535 - Tim Kennedy
item.description: Special Forces operator and retired UFC fighter Tim Kennedy is the founder of Sheepdog Response, a training program aimed at giving law enforcement, military, and others the tools they need to quickly and effectively respond to violent threats.

item.title: #1534 - Ron White
